Translation: “Don't speak to me in English” you were told.'
'the boss was saying to the man, "Tell me!"
'The man was persisting in chopping down trees.' (Geytenbeeks translate 'by choice')
'The dog is persistently chasing the sheep.'
'The boss persisted in telling the man about that.'
'I will hit you if you take my boomerang.'
Language: Various: Ngadju wihnyi badjehny mala wahlu nganyah bargan gahngganyi.

Translation: 'The man slapped her on the face.'
Language: Various: Maliyu baygalu nugalu badjidjahn malahni.

Translation: 'Those men are cutting (wood) for them out there.'
Language: Wa: Mahnyulu galgahla baygalu bagarahgu gimbalahgu.

Translation: 'Listen to those singing behind the house out there.'
Language: Wa: Ganngah manyihni yarbilehla bagarah burambah nguhmbinydjah.

Translation: 'The man threw the spear and it broke in half.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu munah bilahr birani baygalu gawalehn-nguy bahm.

Translation: 'Dark clouds came from up there again.'
'The men came out of the dust coughing all the time.'
Language: Wa: Mahny baygal bahyani mununu bubehngu gulungbaliwahla.

Translation: 'She,g,t angry (her anger emerged) because the children spilt the milk.'
Language: Wa: Janguy bahyanibeh munah guruhmbil gehrbinah mahnyulu jahdjambu.

Translation: 'The sun comes out in the day and then the moon comes out at night.'
Language: Wa: Mala yalgan bahn.gala numgir malangu gibamdjubunydja.

Translation: 'When I got up and looked I saw only a cat.'
Language: Gd: Bahyanah ngay nyahleni nyahni budjigehnbu.

Translation: 'We will see the men again when they arrive here from overseas' (another+country-from)
Language: Gd: Nyahnybu ngali gadji bangilehnydje ngarihngbilnu baygal.

Translation: 'The tips of the Bunya Mountains appear.'
'He speared the,g,ound and a stream of water appeared.'
Language: Cas: Bugwani nyule jagun, bayani gung.
Cas: Wangah yunamah wagar jaruli bala-gihmbadji.

Translation: 'It is not on the new blanket.'
'I'll blow the food to make it cool'
'I'll throw some dirt onto the fire to put it out.'
Language: Wa: Ngayal ngadju birahny galahya waybara balubayah.

Translation: 'The women rubbed each other with fat.'
'I will make a handle for the tomahawk.'
'Pull the handle out of the tomahawk'
'This man has painted (himself) with red ochre.'
'I shall talk to my father today.'
'Where have all the blacks been this long time?'
Language: M: Yindji banggiluru mibiny garahlbu wayrabu?

Translation: 'These kangaroos are jumping on the road.'
'These kangaroos are jumping about all over the road.'
'I will see (one who) will throw a spear.'
'My head got dizzy from spinning round.'
Language: Wa: Bawur ngay gala jangurwahla wahnydjarinyun.

Translation: 'He (a mythical hero) split the rock with his head.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu dunmani mala dawgay bawuru.

Translation: 'The child made her head ache by crying.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu jahdjambu jangmani malahni bawur dunganahyu.

Translation: 'We intend to go today, tomorrow, and the next day too.'
Language: Gd: Gale bayahny ngubuh ngubuhwar ngaleh yanbihgu.

Translation: 'He has grown up (has become a man).'
'Pull that spear out of the man.'
'I am older than you (I am a man before you).'
'woman who is 'after' a man or fond of men'
'Pull that spear out of the man.'
'I am older than you (I am a man before you).'
'Keep on chopping, there's only a little bit of wood.'
Language: Wa: Galgahbu muna bidjangbeh gunu waybar.

Translation: 'He will drink up all the water.'
'We will stay just to work gold.'
'I'm frightened of leeches, but they only suck your blood.'
Language: Wa: Guyir ngay mahnyi juruhmbilnyi, bahnybiny mala gumarbeh.

Translation: 'give me that dilly-bag of yours before we,g,' (and only then will we go)
Language: Wa: Wulah nganhi mala wangah dugul-duguhl ngali-ngu yangahnybe

Translation: 'Berrung came long long ago, with Mommóm (and) Yaburóng.'
Language: M: Berangehn gurilahbu, ngering Mumuhm, Yahburang.

Translation: 'The mother gave the baby some milk.'
Language: Gd: Maliyu mahmidjargandu wulani malahni bidjangganyi guruhm.

Translation: 'I'll spit them out of my mouth.'

Language: Wa: Ngabarmah wahlu malahni jahny birah.

Translation: '(He) used to carry things inside the cave'
'I will make spears for both the boy and the father.'
Language: M: Ngayu juwan ginahny jabugay biyanggay ngeringgay.

Translation: 'A whiteman's skin is soft but an Aborigine's is hard.'
Language: Wa: Malahna yiralingah yulany mahnyu budjur baygalnah-ngu malahnawahr gadjangwahr.

Translation: 'They drank without harm, with good results.'
'We'd better catch some fish for our hunger.'
'The leaves high in the tree are blowing.'
Language: Wa: Wurahng mahnyu malahya jaliya buhmbila mala ngahnydja.
Wa: Gagahri ngali mala mani buhwini.
M: bulah yaburu mibiny, bular(a) yaburu baygal/mibiny

Translation: 'She took a possum-skin and made a drum out of it.'
Language: Cas: Gahngani gihdjay nyangandu, bulbingmani nguy.

Translation: 'The young men today fight among themselves.'
'I made him a spear so he would kill a kangaroo for me.'
Language: Cas: Ngadju nyulagay bilahrmani bumbih nyulayu ngadjah mahni.

Translation: 'I will beat you with a club.'

Language: Bj: Gala baygalu bumani gurumani ngubu warbu.

Translation: 'Listen to those singing behind the house out there (and who I haven't seen yet).'
Language: Wa: Ganngah manyihni yarbilehla bagarah burambah nguhmbinydjah.

Translation: 'If the wind changes, the rain will come.'
Language: Wa: Gala buyan wahnydjarehnyi guwang mala yang-giwahny.

Translation: 'Grandfather nearly hit me with a boomerang.' (ie he threw it, but missed);
Language: Wa: Dagal nganyi bumani ngadjangbinydju bargandu.

Translation: 'The mouth of the corpse we buried today.'
Language: Cas: Jehny galahna dagaynyah bayahny ngali duwanahna.

Translation: 'He will kill me dead because of you.'
'You'll cut your feet on the bones.'
'This one is exactly like that one.'
'(That looks like a) woman over there.' (woman-class over there)

Language: Bj:Turnbl: Gala jananggan gidjuhndjang gale dubaydjinbaya.

Translation: The kangaroo is frightened because he sees me.'
'He (a mythical hero) split the rock with his head.'
Language: Wa:Crowl: Maliyu dunmani mala dawgay bawuru.

Translation: 'The kangaroo is afraid of the man.'
'Who is that chopping in the bush?'
'Tell that woman to run into the bush.'

Language: Y:Sha:Culhm: Ngayu gabir, jalihgi nganyah mung.

Translation: 'Let's go over here to perhaps catch some catfish.' (in the water in this place, where you can't see the catfish)
Language: Wa: Yanah ngali gadjungun namaliyah wagan guram.

Translation: 'after leaving Woodenbong I arrived at Glen Station.'
'Wait there by the red gum tree!'
'I saw him recently at his place.'
'He married the woman lying in the,g,ass.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu ganydjini dubaynyi yunanyun malahya wudjangga.

Translation: 'The man threw the spear and it broke in half.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu munah bilahr birani baygalu gawalehn-nguy bahm.
Wa: Gawani maliyu dubahdjaru munah bilahr nyahn.ganah.

Translation: 'That white horse's left hind leg broke.'
Language: Gd: Gile dalahn yaramanah warambahl jarang gawalehn.
Wa: Mani mala gawarehni malahgu jaligu.
Wa: Nganyah gala bagul gawarehla bugalungahla wangahnyi.

Translation: 'The water is flowing over the stones.'
Language: Wa: Mala nyabay gawarehla wayganda gudjanda mahnyula.
Wa: Mala gumar gawarehla malahya jigaydja.

Translation: 'The wind is blowing from the south.'
'The sand extends as far as the water.'
'a thing which may be made to run (eg car)'
'I run fast, you slowly, I am faster than you.'
Language: M: Ngay gawarehn garayalehn, wanandehn wanyi.

Translation: 'He used to carry things inside the cave.'

Language: Cas: Nyahni nyan.gandu Balugahni, ge,g,n nyule.

Translation: 'Look for a hole there to pour the ashes into.'
Language: Wa: Madjungun guluny ngalawah gehrbiyah mala muruhny.

Translation: 'Do you not want to return home again?'
'I feel sorry for you lying down sick.'
Language: Wa: Ngay wudjah gidjirun.gahla gibing wudja yunanyun.
Bj:Turnbl: Gala jananggan gidjuhndjang gale dubaydjinbaya.

Translation: '... That he might raise his child to adulthood.'
Language: Cas: ... Gah nyule wubihnymayah gidjuhnygamwanbi nyulangah jahdjam.

Translation: 'Where is the paddle of that (this) canoe?'
'I made a mistake in staying here.'
'I never heard such a thing, I never heard anything like that.'
'You ask him to light a fire.'
Language: M:Liv: Wahlu giyah malahnyi waybar gandjiyah/gandjibah.

Translation: 'That white cockatoo speaks like a man.'

Language: Bj: Nganyah banidjargan(du) guhng (or gabing) yangina.

Translation: 'He went that way and went round the sleeper.'
'My nose is blocked up with a cold in the head.'
Language: Wa: Muru nganyah banydjani gulungbaydju bawurahyu.

Translation: 'I saw him recently at this place.'
'We would camp for one or two nights.'
Language: Wa: Ngali guram yabur guram bulahbu jubuny yunahny.
Cas: Ngay gurbalehn bahnden, male baygal yuhdjang.

Translation: 'Berrong came long long ago, with Mommóm (and) Yaburóng.'
Language: M:Liv: Birrangehn gurilahbu, ngering Mamahm, Yaburahng.

Translation: 'The mother gave the baby some milk (the breast)'
Language: Wa: Maliyu mahmidjargandu wulani malahni bidjangganyi guruhm.
Bj: Gala baygalu bumani gurumani ngubu warbu.

Translation: 'If the wind changes, the rain will come.'
Language: Wa: Gala buyan wahnydjarehnyi guwang mala yang giwahny.

Translation: 'The kangaroo is sitting there warming himself because he,g,t caught in the rain.'
Language: Wa: Mala mani yehn.gala nguhnmalehla guwanggu malahni bumanah.

Translation: 'The storm was bad here and there was a lot of rain.'
Language: Wa: Jang munah mugar gadji gehrbilehn guwang.

Translation: 'Put the meat on the fire to be cooked'
'I came from the house that you burnt down.'
Language: Wa: Ngay yang giwani gahbanu nguhmbinyu guybanah(nu) wehlu.

Translation: 'Make a fire to cook the meat (on top of the coals).'
Language: Wa: Waybarmah madji guybayah mahny bulang.

Translation: 'The sand extends as far as the water.'
'(They) carried the kangaroo to the fire for eating.'
'I'm cooking food to eat for the kids.'
Language: Y:Sha:Culhm: Ngayu guybahla nungany jalihgu jahdjamgu.

Translation: 'Don't eat (it), that food is bad, it stinks, there's maggots/flies in it.'
Language: Y:Sha:Culhm: Wunah jah, jang mali bugaw nungany, junbar in it.

Translation: 'I will make spears for both the boy and the father.'
Language: M:Liv: Ngayu juwan ginahny jabugay biyanggay ngeringgay.

Translation: 'The kangaroo is frightened of the boy.'
'I'm Manaldjahli, my country is hard baked.'
Language: Y:Sha:Culhm: Ngawu Manaljahli, nganyah jagun manal.

Translation: 'Put the trap over there so it may catch us a wallaby.'
Language: Cas: Gah babare jahnamah male mundang namayah ngaligal guruman.

Translation: 'Where is the man without a dog?'
'He missed (he threw badly), you (threw it and) missed.'
Language: Wa: Jangmani maliyu nabani, wehlu nabani jangmani.

Translation: 'The child made her head ache by crying.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu jahdjambu jangmani malahni bawur dunganahyu.

Translation: 'My hand is getting sore from writing.'
'I tried to chop the tree but it was too hard.'
Language: Y:Culhm: Ngayu jambamani jali galgayah, jan. gam.

Translation: 'Get down on your hands and knees.'
'The man is speaking while carving the boomerang'
Language: Wa: Mala baygal nguyaymalehla jarwali-nyun mala bargan.
Wa: Nyang wehlu gumbinymani jarwani bargan?

Translation: 'What did you do with that? How did you do that?'
'The echidnas are watching us with their eyes.'
Language: Wa: Mahnyulu bunihnydju nyahla ngalingi jiyawbu. / Mahny bunihny nyahlila ngalingi jiyawbu.
Wa: Ngadju jugahla nyabay / Ngay jugalehla nyabay
Cas: Ngali yan.gahny wanggahn.gu ngalingahgu jumguyu.

Translation: 'I will make spears for both the boy and the father.'
Language: M:Liv: Ngayu juwan ginahny jabugay biyanggay ngeringgay.

Translation: 'I will see (one who) will throw a spear.'
'The meat will go down into my stomach';
Language: Wa: Juwi ge,g,ny bulang malahgu mundugu.

Translation: 'a thing which may be made to run' (e,g, a car)
'a thing which may be made to fly' (e,g, boomerang)
'These all used to live at Pretty Gully a long time ago.'
Language: Wa: gunah mabehr yehn.gandu gadji burigaliya guriyabu.

Translation: 'There are plenty of fish in this creek.'
'the old man has plenty of food.'
'There are a lot of women about here.'
'He (who I can see) is cooking some meat for those men across there (who I can see).'
Language: Wa: Maliyu guybahla bulang gahmgu ngaringgahgu.

Translation: 'The dog got annoyed with the boy for taking his bone.'
Language: Wa: Munah dabahy janguywehn malahgaya janagan-gahya gahnganah mala darigan.

Translation: 'He (who I can see) is cooking some meat for those men across there (who I can see).'
Language: Wa: Maliyu guybahla bulang gahmgu ngaringgahgu.

Translation: 'The dog got annoyed with the boy for taking his bone.'
Language: Wa: Munah dabahy janguywehn malahgaya janagan-gahya gahnganah mala darigan.
Y:Sha:Culhm: Ngayu Manaldjahli, ngay waymalehla manaldjahli.

Translation: 'I'll scrape the bark off the tree.'
Language: Wa: Ngadju gahny mandahny bagul malahya jaliya.
Gd: Manyeh gidjuhm gidjani nganyi munah.

Translation: 'What happened to that boy who was lost?'
Language: Gd: Yindje,g,nggehn mayah jabuh walany wehni.

Translation: 'We will dance a corroboree there tomorrow.'
'How many dogs has the old man?'
'He went to a spot near the tree.'
'Let us go over near the house.'
'At Tenterfield they speak a different language.'
'She picked up a fig to eat.'
'These men took the meat away (so that it can no longer be seen).'
Language: Wa: Gahnyulu baygalu gahngani munah bulang.

Translation: 'Where has he,g,ne?' (he could be seen a moment ago)
'My nose is blocked up with a cold in the head.'
Language: Wa: Muru nganyah bandjani gulungbaydju bawurahyu.

Translation: 'I shot the kangaroo while it was running.'
Language: Wa: Nabani ngadju mala gawari-nyun mani.

Translation: 'I threw a stick at the dog.'
Language: Wa: Ngadju mala dabahy nabani jaliyu.

Translation: 'The whitemen came with guns to shoot the Aborigines.'
Language: Wa: Yirali yang giwadjahn duluhlbiyu nabayah baygalni.

Translation: 'How many dogs has the old man?'
'Where is the dog's master/where is the man with a dog?'
'The leaves high in the tree are blowing.'
Language: Wa: Wurahng mahnyu malahya jaliya buhmbila mala ngahnydja.

Translation: 'I don't know' (lit. 'who there?', answer to 'who is that'')
'They danced a corroboree right down there.'
Language: Wa: Yawahr madji ngahrin judjah mahnyulu.

Translation: 'The children were playing in the water.'
'I saw many boys while they were playing along the creek.'
Language: Gd: Nyahni gumbi jabuhmangi ngahrilinyun balunbu.

Translation: 'I tried to look for you a long time ago.'
Language: Wa: Ngaywahr jambanggehn ngalawalehn gurihbu wihnyi.

Translation: 'Find a hole there to pour the ashes in.'
Language: Wa: Madjungun guluny ngalawah gehrbiyah mala muruhny.
Wa: Galiyu nganyi gur ngala-ngalawani bayahny.
Cas: Ngalawalehn nyule,g,bihnggu. / Ngalawalehn nyulayu gabihng.

Translation: 'Don't tell on me (keep it a secret).'
'He talks too quickly for me/to me.'
'Ask for them on the other side.'
'He crossed from Ballina on a raft.'
'I dug the,g,ound with your stick there (in that area where you can see).'
Language: Wa: Munu ngayalngadju wan.gahyu jaliyu duwani.
Wa: Malaga ngayala yunamah balahyani nyula.

Translation: 'The house shook and so did the,g,ound.'
'I might build a house (put it up).'
'Who is that knocking? (where the person can't be seen but the noise can be heard).'
'Did you see a boomerang like this one in the house?'
Language: Gd: Ngumbinydje nyahni bargan gale nginyehr.

Translation: 'Put that on one like this one.'
'The other man is not like him.'
Language: Gd: Gaybe baygal yagambeh nyule nginyehr.

Translation: 'He wants a spearlike thing to poke through the hole.'
Language: Gd: Juwan nginyehrgi nyula bugayah gabunu.

Translation: 'That woman lived alone together with her daughter.'
Language: Cas: Mirunggan gile bigabindah ngirihny muyumdjargan yan.giluhr.

Translation: 'a person who has had a dance'
'a person who has had a fight'
'a person who has sung a song'
'He is running with a lot of boomerangs.'
'I'm going to the man who's got lots of hair to tell him something.'
Language: Wa:Crowl: Ngay malahba yan.gahla baygalbah guhndun-nguhrganbah wadjiyah malahni.

Translation: 'That tree has got some honey in it.'
'The flood will take you a long way down there.'
Language: Wa: Gahnggany maliyu ngulahru gahri juwi.

Translation: 'You go, it's too hot for you here.'
Language: Cas: Yanah wudjeh, ngurun gunu wudjah.

Translation: 'I really hit him / I hit him indeed.'
'He fell and his arm was damaged.'
Language: Cas: Nyule behn, ganggil nguy gibing-bunggehn.

Translation: 'She took a possum-skin and made a drum out of it.'
Language: Cas: Gahngani gihdjay nyan.gandu, bulbing-mani nguy.

Translation: 'The man is speaking while carving the boomerang.'
Language: Wa: Mala baygal nguyaymalehla jarwalinyun mala bargan.

Translation: 'The man is singing and the woman is dancing.'
Language: Wa: Mala baygal yarbilehla mala-nguy dubaya ngahrila.

Translation: 'Squeeze the honey there so you can drink it (then).'
Language: Wa: Ngihma mala biridju madji mala jugayah-nguy.

Translation: 'Give me that dilly-bag of yours before we,g,.' (and only then will we go)
Language: Wa: Wulah nganyi mala wangah dugulduguhl ngali-ngu yan.gahnybe.

Translation: 'We would go back to Pretty Gully.'
'The turtle is going back to the water.'
'When that wind turns it will rain.'
Language: Cas: Numbuhnggina male buwihyan, guwang nguy badjilehny.

Translation: 'The sun comes out in the day and then the moon comes out at night.'
Language: Wa: Mala yalgan bahn.gala numgir mala-ngu gibam jubunyja

Translation: 'He is running from there with some water.'
'The water is too deep for the boy.'
Language: Wa: Mala nyabay gubung malahgu janagan.gu.

Translation: 'The water is flowing over the stones.'
Language: Wa: Mala nyabay gawarehla wayganda gudjanda mahnyula.

Translation: 'I look about early in the morning.'
'The kangaroo is frightened because he sees me.'
'Look at the boy and the woman.'
'(God) showed (the rainbow, i.e. Gave it as a sign).'
'My back is aching while I am standing up washing clothes.'
'(I) will speak to him while we are bringing the cattle.'
Language: Gd: Nyule,g, gurgun mahny bulah ngali gahngaliwa-nyun.

Translation: 'While I watch the children they will be,g,od.'
Language: Gd: Nyah-nyun jahdjami bugal wan.gahny nyulangam.

Translation: 'Don't go from there unless I tell you.'
Language: Wa: Wanah mununu yanah ngadju wadjehnyidjahng.

Translation: 'The old man told him to bring him some honey.'
Language: Wa: Maliyu dandaygambu wadjini biridju nyulangi yanginiyah.

Translation: 'If you don't encourage them (to learn), they won't understand anything.'
Language: Wa: Yagambeh mahnyuni wadji-wadjehnyi yagambeh mahnyulu ganngahny.

Translation: 'You're a stranger, where are you from?'
'Long ago one white man, a boss, was making others work.'
Language: Gd: Gurubu yabur dagay mahdja ngandurni wahngmalimahn.

Translation: 'The snake is crawling to the whiteman.'
Language: Wa: Mala nguhnyba walanggiwahla malahba yiralibah.

Translation: 'He would have come with a stick and hit you with it.'
Language: Wa: Crowl: Gala yangwehn wambaruga badjinibeh-nguy wihnyi.
Gd: Gah nguy nyula wanani jumbuy.
We: Gahgun mala wayahlin gilah babar.

Translation: 'a thing which may be made to fly (eg boomerang)'
'Put the meat on the fire to be cooked.'
'He chopped the tree down for firewood.'
'Make a fire to cook the meat (on top of the coals).'
Language: Wa: Waybarmah madji guybayah mahny bulang.

Translation: 'These (people) built this house of grass and leaves.'
Language: Wa: Gala nguhmbiny gahnyulu bawgani wudjanggu ngeh wurahnggu.
Cas: Nyanggur wudjeh yirilingah wadjelehla wule nguyeh?

Translation: 'at once, with one blow, with one act'

Language: Wa: Yagambeh ngadju ganngahla gumbaynggirnah nguyay

Translation: 'My hand is burning with the heat.'
'He took his spears along with him.'
'It's "yilah yehyani banidjargan" (where has his wife,g,ne), it's wrong to say "I dunno yilah yehyani"'
Language: Wa: Yilah yehyani banidjargan, yangmani. I dunno yilah yehyani.
Wa: Maliyu banidjargandu yangmani mala banidjarni.

Translation: 'I will go and have a feed.'
'We used to go to Tabulam, and we would stay two nights.'
Language: Wa: Ngali yan.gahn dahbalamna bulahbu jubuny yunahny.

Translation: 'Give me the dilly-bag while we're walking around.'
Language: Wa: Wulah nganyi mala dugul-duguhl yanbali-nyun.

Translation: 'They used to sing the coroboree before the whiteman came.'
Language: Wa: Yarbilidjahndu yawahrgu yagambu yirali yang giwa-nyun.

Translation: 'I came to tell you there is a corroboree there.'
Language: Wa: Gandehn ngay wadjiyah blaganmirni yawahr gilah ngahrila.
Gd: Nyaguhng wuladjahn yinggani guhndun gawgalihgubih.

Translation: 'We used to go to Tabulam, and we would stay two nights.'
Language: Wa: Ngali yan.gahn dahbalamna bulahbudjubuny yunahny.

Translation: 'I will lie down here/I will sleep here.'
'That shield up there is on the hillside.'
Language: Wa: Gala ngahnydja gilah bagarah bagah yunahla bahmbinydja.

Translation: 'Let's go and camp somewhere out of this rain.'
Language: Cas: Yanah ngali yunah galahnyi guwangnyi.
